content.text:
Among the following binary trees, which one may become a binary search decision tree (excluding external nodes)

A. <image 1>
B. <image 2>
C. <image 3>
D. <image 4>

In a binary search decision tree, for any node, all elements in its left subtree are less than it, and all elements in its right subtree are greater than it.

Option A is incorrect because the left subtree of the root node contains an element that is greater than the root node.
Option B is correct because it satisfies the properties of a binary search decision tree.
Option C is incorrect because the right subtree of the root node contains an element that is less than the root node.
Option D is incorrect because the left subtree of the root node contains an element that is greater than the root node.

Therefore, the answer is B.
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
